title: An unused HashMap with an enum key recommends borrowing, not implementing Hash on the enum

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code ([playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=507c4abfd7e94d0eb861dbb229906d3b)):

```rust
use std::collections::HashMap;

#[derive(Clone, Copy, Debug, PartialEq, Eq)]
enum MyEnum {
	AAA,
	BBB,
	CCC,
}

fn main() {
	let _hash_map = HashMap::from([
	    (MyEnum::AAA, 0),
	    (MyEnum::BBB, 1),
	    (MyEnum::CCC, 2),
	]);
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0277]: the trait bound `MyEnum: From<[(MyEnum, {integer}); 3]>` is not satisfied
   --> src/main.rs:11:32
    |
11  |       let _hash_map = HashMap::from([
    |  _____________________-------------_^
    | |                     |
    | |                     required by a bound introduced by this call
12  | |         (MyEnum::AAA, 0),
13  | |         (MyEnum::BBB, 1),
14  | |         (MyEnum::CCC, 2),
15  | |     ]);
    | |_____^ expected an implementor of trait `From<[(MyEnum, {integer}); 3]>`
    |
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `From<[(MyEnum, {integer}); 3]>` for `HashMap<MyEnum, {integer}>`
note: required by `from`
help: consider borrowing here
    |
11  |     let _hash_map = HashMap::from(&[
    |                                   +
11  |     let _hash_map = HashMap::from(&mut [
    |                                   ++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

Ideally the output should look like:

A suggestion to derive `Hash`. Not a suggestion to borrow.
